description: Numbers that are the sum of 3 but no fewer nonzero squares.
references: G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers. 3rd ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1954, p. 311.
links: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Square Number.
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
formula: Legendre: a nonnegative integer is a sum of three (or fewer) squares iff it is not of the form 4^k m with m == 7 (mod 8).
prog: (Haskell)a000419 n = a000419_list !! (n-1)a000419_list = filter ((== 3) . a002828) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 26 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_ and _J. H. Conway_
